meanings.definition: A pipe that carries rainwater from a roof to the ground.
meanings.sent1: The downpipe on the house directs rainwater to the garden.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the downpipe is clear so the rainwater can flow freely.
meanings.sent3: The downpipe decided to take a shortcut and water the flowers directly.
meanings.sent4: The downpipe was like a helpful guide, leading the rainwater safely to the ground.
meanings.sent5: I painted the downpipe bright red to add a pop of color to the house.

meanings.sent1: The ball downpipes from the top shelf and lands softly on the floor.
meanings.sent2: I watched the leaves downpipe from the tree in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The cat downpipes gracefully from the roof, surprising everyone below.
meanings.sent4: Her mood seemed to downpipe as the day went on, becoming more somber.
meanings.sent5: The sun downpipes below the horizon, painting the sky in beautiful colors.
